intro: Linum pusillum, commonly known as small flax or dwarf flax, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Linaceae family and typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, delicate blue or white flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branched. Linum pusillum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
